title: Mod sends me to Riot support, support sends me to boards. Is a normal here or I'm missing smth?
body:
So I post a topic regarding "not all Xerath exploited accounts are banned".
It hangs for a few days and [mod removes it with notion that I should write to support](http://prnt.sc/ex7i4z).
[Support closes ticket and sends me to boards](http://prnt.sc/ex7id9).

So which one is it?

replies.body:
Your boards post title (I can't see the content) and removal message suggests there was focus on the player, which would make it fall under **Name & Shame** for reporting because that isn't allowed on the boards.

Then your ticket doesn't mention anything about the player, but instead focuses on feedback about the script/exploit. The boards are the proper place to report a bugs and submit feedback, but not to report players.

If you keep your message consistent and focused on one particular point, this won't happen.

Hmm. You may actually be right.
I didn't hide summoner name from chat screenshot.

But posts focus was on suggesting to make a pass on Xerath games and ban players not by precedent (reporting system, support ticket) but by checking status of specific games.

Deep Terror Nami with the assist!

There was a bit of miscommunication here. When you posted on the boards it was mostly about reporting the players I'm assuming, which would have been best handled by reporting them or hitting us up in a ticket. 

When you sent the ticket however, you focused on the Xerath issue, which is best posted in the Gameplay or Report a Bug boards.

Thanks for supporting.

Original boards post had the same sense. The only misconception could have come from attached image which featured a screenshot of a player saying that not all his accounts are banned but only those that were featured in videos.
I assume Riot bans players based on precedent - reported using ingame reporting system, reported through support by linking a video, etc. I am a programmer so an idea came to my mind. There are metrics (like KDA or damaged made to minions with autos) that can be used to extract lists of players that presumably use exploit, check and ban them.

Original post from "General Discussion":
> I feel some of them will be using proxies/vpns so it will be unreliant to ban accounts by IP.
But you can extract a list of accounts that have unrealistic KDA and some other metric and ban them.
At least hackers won't feel safe or would have a more difficult life with trying to fake to pass the check.

> In the end it's just a bunch of ordinary people (users) and only one/couple people that developed the hack.
I mean:
-their numbers are limited
-ordinary people won't feel as safe after their other accounts would be disabled

P.S.:
Looks like the issue was names not being hidden in chat screenshot. I didn't think about that since post wasn't focused on player behavior also mod didn't mention it.

More than fairly sure it should be player support.
Try linking the boards message in your ticket.
